Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti
Description: This small shabti in green faience, which dates from the 26th Dynasty, belonged to the divine father and  prophet, Senebef. Very characteristic are the wig and the false beard painted in black. The collections of the Louvre Museum and of the Vivenel Museum at Compiègne  preserve many shabtis of the same person.
